CAREER SUMMARY
March 2020 to date IMA Group
Position: Area Manager
(Industrial Pharmaceutical Packaging, 6.000 people, 1.200M€ turnover)
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the business development and sales of IMA Life division in all the Iberian market
Contact, follow-up and meet with customers in order to generate new opportunities, prepare and negotiate quotations until sales finalization
Support for the management of the projects procured, since pre-sale, through development, delivery until post sale
Achievements: Increase the sales of the division of 20% in the last two years
June 2017 to Feb 2020 Dara Pharmaceutical Packaging
Position: Service Operations Manager
(Industrial Pharmaceutical Packaging, 250 people, 40M€ turnover)
Responsibilities:
Team leadership of 30 people: project managers, designers, programmers, technicians, supply chain. Coordination of subcontractors and agents across worldwide countries
Responsible for on-site management operations in terms of execution processes, planning, costs, quality, efficiency, deliveries, customer services.
Contact, follow-up and meet with worldwide customers in order to generate new opportunities, prepare and negotiate quotations until sales finalization
Ensuring financial performances across delivery operations
Management of operations in process innovation and continuous improvement, change and digital transformation
Achievements: Increase of productivity and of the gross margin of 25% in one year of the Service department through the implementation of a continuous improvement project for all operational processes, optimization of the organization, its supply chain, the implementation of a KPIs system.
May 2012 to March 2017 Sener Ingenieria y Sistemas
Position: Program Manager and Business Development Manager
(Industrial Aeronautics and Healthcare, 5.000 people,1.200M€ turnover)
Responsibilities:
Management of the client portfolio: strategic planning, budgeting, business development and go to new markets / OEM worldwide clients
International Project management and multidisciplinary team leading (10M$, 20 people)
Creation of relationships with partners, strategic suppliers, bid management, contract management and monitoring of commercial projects.
Support to the operations management for transformation project and continuous improvement
Achievements: Definition and implementation of the following plans:
Strategic business with fulfilment of consolidation of the positioning of the company in the US aeronautical market and entry into new markets in the US and Brazil
Implementation of the Business plan and operative for production and serial distribution of automatic machines for medical diagnosis.
Sept 2008 to April 2012 Serra Aeronautics – AERNNOVA
Position: Head of Project Management
(Industrial Aeronautics, 300 people, 40M€ turnover)
Responsibilities:
Head of the project management team. Establishment of methodologies and procedures for project management and operation management
Responsible of the projects execution and delivery, for the operational planning of the aeronautical business, and for the coordination of interdepartmental activities
Ensuring financial performances and Responsible of the P&L of the business unit
Achievements: Management of a multidisciplinary team of up to 40 people, with closure of the € 15M program in budget and critical deadlines. Successful negotiation with management and clients to recover critical situations of three projects: obtaining orders extension and exit of a project to avoid risk of occurring in more costs.
May 2004 to August 2008 Carlo Gavazzi OHB Group
Position: Project Manager
(Space, 130 people, 20M€)
Responsibilities:
Leader of multiple projects and multidisciplinary teams in the space sector throughout their lifecycle ensuring a successful delivery of mechatronics units and payloads to the European Space Agency.
Achievements: Leadership of an international industrial organization with European stakeholders (public companies, universities, research scientists, EU officers, technology experts, industrial associations and private companies), with successful closure of projects for the European Space Agency.
Jan 2002 to April 2004 Altran Italia
Position: Project Engineer
(Consulting, 100 people)
Responsibilities:
SW validation and Qualification tests in ESA mechatronic projects at Thales-Alenia Space, and defence projects in Agusta/Westland
COMMENT
His professional experience has been developed in multinational and family companies of the High Tech and Industrial sectors (Aerospace, Pharmaceutical), technological Start-ups, in multicultural environments and situations of high complexity. He is used to leading projects with an innovative vision, but at the same time transversal and very business based, combining the strategic part with the operative part. His areas of special competence:
•	International Project management
•	Strategic planning, Business development and Go to market
•	Team management and management of Stakeholders
•	Operation management
Additional Infrmation
ACADEMIC COLLABORATOR at ESADE BUSINESS SCHOOL – Professor of BBA course ‘Competing from Operations’ and coordinator of the international section – 2021 - present
Tutoring at UPC – Professor of course ‘Project Management’– 2016
PMI Certification 2015-2021
Consulting and equities in technologic Start-ups – 2019
Other Skills: Leadership, strong communication, problem solving, analytical and strategic thinking, result oriented
